inlineContent.text: To use the ADITION AdSDK the application developer will need to acquire the AdSDK library as well as
and
pairs from an ADITION customer.

If your experience “cannot load page” errors when navigating between entries in this documentation, then the culprit is very likely an activated ad blocker. Many of the documented classes and services have names related to advertising terms. We found that this can trigger ad blockers. So please disable your adblocker if you have issues.
To serve advertisements using the Adition AdSDK you will typically:
Add the package dependencies (public, without dSYM) or integrate xcframework via Nexus (with dSYM).

Apps using this AdSDK must be built at least for deployment target of iOS 14.0.
You can follow the AdSDK integration
with code examples where you will create your first application using the AdSDK.
Starting with IOS 14, you, as a developer, are required to ask for permission to track a user. Learn more in Apple’s
The SDK offers a wide range of functionality that can be used for tracking. If you use tracking in your application, you are responsible for:
1. Adding a privacy manifest to your project.
Learn more in Apple’s
. Apple requires some kind of domain related to tracking. You can use the following domain as a tracking domain:
2. Passing
Even if the user denies the tracking, IOS will not block URL requests for
domain from the SDK. In addition to adding this domain to the privacy manifest, you should pass the
parameter to the SDK if the user has denied tracking. You can do this using the
method.

content.text: Explaining the concepts of AdSDK server requests

inlineContent.text: Your app uses the AdSDK to request ads from an ad server.
To enable the ad server to serve relevant ads, you must pass certain information. The first argument you will pass when creating an
is the

By default, the SDK opens an external browser when processing a target URL. You can override this behaviour with your own. For example, this can be useful if you want to open your internal browser in your application to process the target URL. To do this, you pass the
to the
method.
will emit two types of events:
Lifecycle events:
See
for more details.
Tracking events:
See
for more details.
To enable the partial visibility events
with inline ad, you have to add the
modifier. See more in
Which tracking events are enabled for which Advertisements is configured in the ADITION Backend.
To gain a more detailed understanding of how to work with state and events, we recommend going through our
inApp-ClickURLs is a feature which allows you to specify a custom schemed click url. An example of a custom scheme url is
. Banners with this option selected will not open a browser when it is clicked. If an app is installed on the device for the given URL schema, then this app will be opened to process the URL.

The ADITION click counting works by initially calling the ad server url which will then count the click and redirect to the banner click url. By default this is done by the built-in ADITION browser. The exception to this default click handling is with inApp-ClickURL banners, as they are handled by the SDK internally which ensures the click is successfully counted and the intent fired.

Tagging targeting is a server side tagging (user profile) feature. You are able to tag a user currently using your application with key = value tags that can be used in targeting of campaigns within the ADITION ad serving platform.
See

(Combine) and
(Async/Await) methods. You can pass all tags through the initializer.
Tracking is a server side feature. You are able to perform tracking request to track your conversions.
See
. The app can fire the track request as soon as a conversion occurs within the app. See
(Combine) and
(Async/Await).

There is function called

Performable tap events:
As App developer, you can create your own custom ad formats. For example, you can implement interactive ad formats like surveys, rotating galleries or Ads that play video.

Your custom ad format can be configured in the Adition backend. There you can define a creative template with custom JSON that will be delivered as part of the ad. For example, you could provide a way to configure some styling aspects for the ad by adding custom JSON key-value-pairs to the creative template. On the app side, you can implement your custom Ad with native technologies like Swift and SwiftUI.
As part of your custom ad you will need to provide:
a controller class which implements the
protocol;
a view class which implements the
protocol.
To make the SDK aware of your ad, you need to register it with the SDK using

. Once your custom ad is registered, the SDK will  signal the Adition ad server that it can handle this new ad format for  subsequent ad request. The SDK will also manage the creation of the instances of your controller and view classes in case actual ad content is delivered by the ad server.
Your controller class needs to implement the
method of the
protocol. This method will be called every time
manages to load advertisement data. In it you can process the data, and prepare the
for display.
Your controller and the SDK communicate with each other using events and states, see
and
You can find an example of the implementation of both controllers and views for custom ads in the documentation for
and
